      <p><strong>The BIODAS Team</strong> is pleased to share information about the <strong>PACE-UP Full PhD Scholarship 2026‚Äì2030</strong> ‚Äì an opportunity for young Vietnamese researchers who wish to pursue a scientific career in the field of infectious diseases at one of the world's leading centers for tropical medicine ‚Äì the <strong>Bernhard Nocht Institute, Hamburg, Germany</strong>.</p>

      <p>The program is part of the <strong>PACE-UP</strong> project funded by <strong>DAAD</strong>, providing a modern, multinational research environment and extensive academic development opportunities, contributing to promoting research capacity and scientific cooperation between Vietnam and Germany.</p>

      <p><strong>Official website:</strong>

      <h2>1. Program Introduction</h2>
      <p>The program is <strong>recruiting for one fully funded PhD position</strong> in the field of <strong>basic research on infectious diseases</strong>. The position is fully funded for 4 years by DAAD, within the framework of the PACE-UP project. The candidate will pursue a PhD at the <strong>Bernhard Nocht Institute for Tropical Medicine (BNITM)</strong>, in collaboration with the <strong>University of Hamburg</strong>, Germany.</p>

      <h2>2. Research Topic</h2>
      <p><em>Development of an ex vivo mosquito midgut model to simulate the infection process of insect-borne viruses.</em>  
      The study will examine the effects of temperature, infection dose, and virus viability in gut tissue. The results will be evaluated for their applicability to different virus groups and the potential for expansion to research on virus inhibitors.</p>

      <h2>4. Application Requirements</h2>
      <p>The program encourages applicants from all academic backgrounds, especially first-generation graduates and underrepresented groups in scientific research.</p>
      <div class="highlight-box">
        <ul>
          <li>Master's degree or Medical Doctor with a Master's degree in a related field (Health Sciences, Biology, Medicine, Public Health,...).</li>
          <li>Good academic record and a clear research orientation.</li>
          <li>Proficiency in English (spoken & written, equivalent to IELTS ‚â• 6.5).</li>
          <li>Ability to read and analyze specialized scientific literature.</li>

          <li>Interest in mosquito research and ability to work in a high-level biosafety environment (BSL2/3).</li>
        </ul>

          <li>Contact information of 2 academic referees.</li>
